text: EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT THIS AGREEMENT made on the 20th January, 2025 between Brainster Math Learning Technologies Private Limited and Brainmage AI Inc. (jointly and severally known as the “Employer”) and Varaprasad Songa (the “Employee”) witnesses that whereas the Employer wishes to employ the Employee, and the Employee wishes to be employed by the Employer, in the capacity of AI Engineer; and whereas the Employer and the Employee have agreed to enter into this Agreement in respect of the employment of the Employee by the Employer, on the terms and subject to the conditions set out herein, now therefore in consideration of the covenants and agreements herein contained, and other good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows: ARTICLE 1 - EMPLOYMENT 1.01 Employment. Subject to the terms and conditions hereof, the Employee shall be employed by the Employer in the capacity of AI Engineer and shall report to such individual as the Employer may designate from time to time. The Employee agrees to devote his full energies, abilities, attention, and time to the performance of his employment obligations and responsibilities. The Employee further agrees that he will not engage in any other activity which conflicts or interferes with, or in any way compromises his performance of, such obligations and responsibilities, without the prior written authorization of the Employer. 1.02 Duties. The Employee agrees to perform such duties as they are set forth in Schedule A, or as are otherwise specified by the Employer from time to time, and to abide by the Employer’s code of conduct, as may be amended in writing from time to time. The parties agree that the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall remain in force notwithstanding that the position and/or duties of the Employee may be changed from time to time, provided that any such change in position and/or duties does not constitute constructive dismissal at law. The employee acknowledges that the Employee may be required to perform duties outside of the Employer’s business hours and/or on weekends. The Employer’s usual business hours are 9 AM to 6 PM on weekdays and 9 AM to 2 PM on Saturdays. 1.03 Work Location: The Employee shall perform his Duties as mentioned in 1.02 at the location specified by the Employer. This location shall be subject to change at the sole discretion of the- Employer. The location is expected to be in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 1 of 10 1.04 Term of Employment. The term (the “Term”) of the Employee’s employment shall commence on 17 February, 2025 (the “Start Date”), and shall continue until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. ARTICLE 2 - REMUNERATION 2.01 Base Salary. The Employer shall pay the Employee an annual gross base salary (the “Base Salary”) of INR 4,20,000 payable on a basis no less frequent than monthly. 2.02 Option Issuance. On the Start Date, the Employer shall grant the Employee certain options to purchase shares of

expected to be in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 1 of 10 1.04 Term of Employment. The term (the “Term”) of the Employee’s employment shall commence on 17 February, 2025 (the “Start Date”), and shall continue until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. ARTICLE 2 - REMUNERATION 2.01 Base Salary. The Employer shall pay the Employee an annual gross base salary (the “Base Salary”) of INR 4,20,000 payable on a basis no less frequent than monthly. 2.02 Option Issuance. On the Start Date, the Employer shall grant the Employee certain options to purchase shares of the Corporation in accordance with the option agreement attached as Schedule B. 2.03 Vacation. The Employee shall be entitled to fifteen (15) work days of paid per calendar year during the Term, provided that such entitlement shall be pro rata for any incomplete calendar year. The Employee’s vacation shall be taken at a time or times acceptable to the Employer, acting reasonably. The Employer and the Employee confirm that it is their mutual intention that the entitlements set out in this Section 2.03 shall, in the aggregate, satisfy both the vacation time and vacation pay requirements set out in the relevant Employment laws in effect in India (as now enacted or as the same may from time to time be amended, re-enacted, or replaced, and in the case of such amendment, re- enactment, or replacement, with any references herein being read as referring to such amended, re-enacted, or replaced act, the “Act”). For greater certainty, while nothing in this Agreement shall be construed so as to restrict the Employee’s entitlement to receive vacation pay at the times set out in the Act, such vacation pay shall serve as the Employee’s pay during the fifteen (15) days of paid vacation provided for herein. 2.04 Withholdings. All amounts payable to the Employee pursuant to this Agreement shall be subject to such withholding or source deductions as may be applicable from time to time. ARTICLE 3 - EMPLOYEE'S COVENANTS 3.01 Service. The Employee shall always faithfully serve the Employer and shall use his best efforts to promote the interests of the Employer and its affiliates. 3.02 Duties and Responsibilities. The Employee shall duly and diligently perform all of the duties assigned to him while in employment of the Employer and shall truly and faithfully account for and deliver to the Employer all money, securities, and things of value belonging to the Employer which the Employee may from time to time receive for, from, Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 2 of 10 or on account of the Employer. 3.03 Non-Disclosure. The Employee acknowledges that by virtue of his involvement in the business carried on by the Employer, and his employment by the Employer hereunder, he has been and will be granted access to confidential and proprietary data and information with respect to the affairs of the Employer, its clients, and such parties with whom the Employer transacts from time to time. This information (hereinafter referred

securities, and things of value belonging to the Employer which the Employee may from time to time receive for, from, Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 2 of 10 or on account of the Employer. 3.03 Non-Disclosure. The Employee acknowledges that by virtue of his involvement in the business carried on by the Employer, and his employment by the Employer hereunder, he has been and will be granted access to confidential and proprietary data and information with respect to the affairs of the Employer, its clients, and such parties with whom the Employer transacts from time to time. This information (hereinafter referred to as “Confidential Information”) includes, but is not limited to, product data; marketing and operational programs, procedures, and techniques; business, management, investment, and human resources strategies; pricing of products and services; information management and information technology systems and procedures; financial information; and notes, records, data, software, and other documents reflecting the affairs of the Employer, its clients, and such parties with whom the Employer transacts from time to time. The Employee covenants and agrees that he shall not, either during the Term or at any time thereafter, (i) disclose the Confidential Information to any person other than for the Employer’s purposes, or (ii) use the Confidential Information for his own purposes or for any purposes other than those of the Employer. Confidential Information shall remain the exclusive property of the Employer. No interest, license, or any right respecting the Confidential Information is granted to the Employee under this Agreement, by implication, or otherwise. The Employee agrees that he will only access Confidential Information as may be directly required in connection with the provision of his duties and responsibilities and not for any other purpose. 3.04 Non-Competition. The Employee acknowledges that by virtue of his involvement in the business carried on by the Employer, and his employment by the Employer hereunder, he has a highly competitive knowledge of the Employer’s current and contemplated businesses that, if used for the benefit of any third party, would be highly detrimental to the Employer ‘s competitive advantage in its current and contemplated businesses. The Employee covenants and agrees that he shall not, (i) at any time, during which he has any working relationship with the Employer, whether as an employee, consultant, or otherwise, including the period of his employment hereunder; or (ii) for a period of twelve (12) months after he has ceased to have a working relationship with the Employer. either individually, or in partnership or jointly or in conjunction with any person or entity, as principal, agent, trustee, shareholder, employee, or consultant, in any manner whatsoever, whether directly or indirectly, carry on or be engaged in or concerned with or interested in, or advise, lend money to, guarantee the debts or obligations of, or permit his name or any part thereof to be used or employed by or associated with, any Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 3 of 10 person or entity engaged in or concerned with or interested in any business of

have a working relationship with the Employer. either individually, or in partnership or jointly or in conjunction with any person or entity, as principal, agent, trustee, shareholder, employee, or consultant, in any manner whatsoever, whether directly or indirectly, carry on or be engaged in or concerned with or interested in, or advise, lend money to, guarantee the debts or obligations of, or permit his name or any part thereof to be used or employed by or associated with, any Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 3 of 10 person or entity engaged in or concerned with or interested in any business of Artificial Intelligence Systems as is generally understood, provided that nothing herein shall restrict or prevent the Employee from owning as a passive investor less than five per cent (5%) of any class of securities of any entity that is listed for trading on a recognized stock exchange. 3.05 Non-Solicitation. The Employee covenants and agrees that he shall not, (i) at any time, during which he has any working relationship with the Employer, whether as an employee, consultant, or otherwise, including the period of his employment hereunder; or (ii) for a period of eighteen (18) months after he has ceased to have a working relationship with the Employer. (A) approach for the purpose of conducting business with any customer or supplier of the Employer or its affiliates, or (B) solicit, or attempt to induce to leave, any employee or consultant of the Employer or its affiliates. 3.06 Inventions. The Employee agrees to promptly inform the Employer of any and all developments, inventions, software, systems, designs, improvements, applications and discoveries of whatever nature, patentable or not, which the Employee, alone or with others, has, makes, conceives of, or reduces to practice or writing during the Term and which (i) pertain or relate in any way to the current or contemplated businesses of the Employer, or (ii) result from the use of the Employer’s time, materials, information, or facilities (collectively, “Intellectual Property”), whether or not conceived during regular working hours. The Employee agrees that all Intellectual Property, and all documents, data, and information relating thereto, is the sole and exclusive property of the Employer. The Employee agrees to assign, and hereby does assign, to the Employer, all Intellectual Property, and waives any moral rights the Employee may have in or to such Intellectual Property. The Employee agrees to (i) assist the Employer, atthe Employer’s expense, both during and after the Term, in obtaining intellectual property protection for any Intellectual Property, and (ii) execute all documents and do all such things which are necessary or advisable to obtain such protection, to vest in the Employer full and exclusive title thereto, and to protect the Intellectual Property against infringement by others. The Employer acknowledges and agrees that this provision does not apply to any material, information or business developments that the Employee has already conceived, made or reduced to practice or writing prior to the date of this Agreement, and that they will have no

Employer’s expense, both during and after the Term, in obtaining intellectual property protection for any Intellectual Property, and (ii) execute all documents and do all such things which are necessary or advisable to obtain such protection, to vest in the Employer full and exclusive title thereto, and to protect the Intellectual Property against infringement by others. The Employer acknowledges and agrees that this provision does not apply to any material, information or business developments that the Employee has already conceived, made or reduced to practice or writing prior to the date of this Agreement, and that they will have no interest or title in the same. 3.07 Employee Restrictions. (a) It is the intention of the parties that the preceding Sections 3.03 through 3.06 be Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 4 of 10 given liberal construction to the end that the Employer shall be protected from unfair competition by former employees. The Employee acknowledges and agrees that all conduct, schemes, switching or changing of customers, or other devices, whether direct or indirect, which unfairly deprive the Employer of its business and customers will be a violation of this Article. Further, the Employee acknowledges and agrees that irreparable harm to the Employer, for which it may not be adequately compensated in damages, will be sustained by the Employer if the Employee violates or threatens to violate the covenants and agreements set out in this Article, and the Employee agrees that the Employer will be entitled to seek, in any court of competent jurisdiction, equitable relief by way of temporary and/or permanent injunction to enjoin any violation of any said covenants and agreements. The rights and remedies given to or reserved by the Employer under this Agreement shall be construed to be cumulative and not exclusive of any other right or remedy available to the Employer. All references to the Employer in Sections 3.03 through 3.06 shall be deemed to include any affiliates of the Employer from time to time. (b) The Employee acknowledges and agrees that the provisions of this Agreement, and particularly those of this Article, are fair and reasonable, and that the duration, extent, and application of each respective restriction of this Article is no greater than is reasonable and necessary for the protection of the legitimate commercial interests of the Employer. Notwithstanding any provision of this Agreement to the contrary, if any provision found in this Article is found to be unreasonable to any extent by a court of competent jurisdiction adjudicating upon the validity of such provision, whether as to the scope, area, or duration of provision restriction, then such restriction shall be reduced to that which is in fact declared reasonable by such court, or a subsequent court of competent jurisdiction. ARTICLE 4 - TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT 4.01 Termination by Employer for Cause. The Employer may terminate this Agreement at any time, in its absolute discretion, for just cause, as defined both at common law and by statute, including negligence, misconduct, disobedience, or neglect of duty that

to be unreasonable to any extent by a court of competent jurisdiction adjudicating upon the validity of such provision, whether as to the scope, area, or duration of provision restriction, then such restriction shall be reduced to that which is in fact declared reasonable by such court, or a subsequent court of competent jurisdiction. ARTICLE 4 - TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT 4.01 Termination by Employer for Cause. The Employer may terminate this Agreement at any time, in its absolute discretion, for just cause, as defined both at common law and by statute, including negligence, misconduct, disobedience, or neglect of duty that is not trivial and has not been condoned by the Employer. Termination for just cause will be effective immediately, and you will not be entitled to receive any termination notice (or pay in lieu), or, if applicable, statutory severance pay. 4.02 Termination by Employer without Cause. (a) The Employer may terminate the Employee’s employment, in the Employer’s sole discretion, upon providing the Employee with 15 days’ notice. The Employer shall Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 5 of 10 pay the Employee salary during the notice period. (b) Any group insurance or other benefits to which the Employee is entitled will continue only during the notice period, and any vacation pay owed by the Employer will be paid to the Employee. (c) The Employee agrees that the notice, salary continuation, and/or payment to which the Employee is entitled pursuant to Subsection 4.02(a) shall be reasonable in all the circumstances and the Employee will not be entitled to any additional notice, pay in lieu of notice and/or severance at common law or otherwise. The Employee further agrees that as a condition of the payment to him of any pay in lieu of notice and severance pay herein, he will sign a complete release in favor of the Employer in a reasonable and customary form provided to him by the Employer. 4.03 Termination by Employee. The Employee may terminate his employment here under upon at least thirty (30) days prior written notice given to the Employer. The Employer, in its sole discretion, may elect to accept such a notice period, or to reduce or eliminate such notice period. The Employee will not receive any bonus not already received by the Employee as of the date of termination. ARTICLE 5 – GENERAL 5.01 Sections and Headings. The division of this Agreement into Articles, Sections, and Subsections, and the insertion of headings, are for the convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of this Agreement. 5.02 Entire Agreement and Drafting. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and cancels and supersedes any prior understandings and agreements between the parties hereto with respect thereto. There are no representations, warranties, forms, conditions, undertakings, or collateral agreements, whether express, implied, or statutory, between the parties other than as expressly set forth in this Agreement. Each party confirms that the terms of this Agreement are fully

Subsections, and the insertion of headings, are for the convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of this Agreement. 5.02 Entire Agreement and Drafting. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and cancels and supersedes any prior understandings and agreements between the parties hereto with respect thereto. There are no representations, warranties, forms, conditions, undertakings, or collateral agreements, whether express, implied, or statutory, between the parties other than as expressly set forth in this Agreement. Each party confirms that the terms of this Agreement are fully understood by such party, and that any rule of construction or doctrine of interpretation which has the result of construing or interpreting any ambiguity against the drafting party shall not be applicable in the interpretation of this Agreement. 5.03 Assignment. This Agreement shall be assignable by the Employer on written notice to the Employee. Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 6 of 10 5.04 Currency. Unless explicitly stated otherwise, all references to currency in this Agreement shall be deemed to refer to Indian Rupees. 5.05 Severability. Subject to Subsection 3.07(b), if any provision of this Agreement is determined to be invalid or unenforceable in whole or in part, such invalidity or unenforceability shall attach only to such provision or part thereof, and the remaining part of such provision, and all other provisions hereof, shall continue in full force and effect. 5.06 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India applicable therein. In particular, and without limitation, the payroll deductions and remittances in respect of the Employee’s employment hereunder shall be in accordance with the laws applicable to employees in India. 5.07 Notices. Any notice or other communication given in connection with this Agreement shall be given in writing, and may be given by personal delivery or by registered mail addressed to the recipient as follows: 5.08 No Waiver. No waiver by the Employer of any right or remedy pursuant to this Agreement, or delay or omission in the exercise or enforcement of any such right or remedy, shall be considered a waiver of any other or subsequent right or remedy of the Employer. 5.09 Independent Advice. The Employee confirms that the Employer has strongly advised that the Employee seek independent legal advice with respect to this Agreement. By signing this Agreement, the Employee confirms that he has had sufficient opportunity to seek such advice, and has either obtained such advice, or has waived his right to do so. Document Ref: YNQHM-CBWUB-AMQCA-ZSWTU Page 7 of 10 IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this Agreement on the date first set forth above.
